oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1857 US saber
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is an imported copy of the US Model 1857 (1860) cavalry saber made by J.E. Bleckmann of Solingen, Germany. The makers mark of a bow and arrow encircling a "B" and "M" is present. The single strand of brass wire replaced the original woven wire and the leather covering on the grip is also missing. Donor surmises that the saber belonged to John Marshall Dickey, Co. A, 44th Tenn. Inf., CSA. He was detailed as blacksmith, captured at Chickamauga, and held at Rock Island Prison until 1865, May.
